preparation.raw_text:
1. Weigh out 1 g of arsenic using a precise balance. 
 2. Weigh out 12 g of lead. 
 3. Weigh out 20 g of yttrium. 
 4. In a fume hood or well-ventilated area, combine all three materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 
 5. Stir the mixture thoroughly using a clean stainless steel spatula to ensure uniform distribution of all components.

steps: 1. Carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible.
2. If necessary, use sandpaper (starting with 200-grit and progressing to 600-grit) to smooth out the surfaces of the sample.
3. Clean the sample with a soft cloth to remove any residual dust.
4. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating if the sample will be exposed to environmental conditions.
